Posts.Title: Birth Control During Treatment

Posts.Content: Hello all, I just wanted to give you some information on the above email. Unfortunately, there plenty of hoax emails that get circulated these days. Please feel free to call the National Cancer Information Center whenever you receive them to check them out. Cancer Information Specialists can be reached 24 hours a day at 1-800-227-2345. http://www.cancer.org/docroot/MED/content/MED_6_1x_Lipstick_and_Lead.asp?sitearea=MED Take care and be well, Dana CSN Dana
Posts.Title: Interesting reading - FYI

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone, The discussion boards, as well as the other features of the Cancer Survivors Network, are designed for the exchange of support and anecdotal information, which includes treatment information within the context of personal experience. The goal of this exchange is to facilitate support and encouragement amongst our members. Posting medical information out of this context lends itself to appearance of the promotion of specific treatments and/or research with would be a violation of the terms and conditions of the Cancer Survivors Network. Discussion regarding treatment options and how they relate to you or a loved one's personal cancer experience is always encouraged. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at webmaster@acscsn.org. As always, if you have any specific medical questions regarding diagnosis or treatment, we encourage you to contact the American Cancer Society's National Cancer Information Center (NCIC). They can be reached at 1-800-227-2345 or by clicking on the "Contact ACS" link at the top of this screen. Take care and be well, Dana CSN Dana
Posts.Title: Need to know something...

Posts.Content: In addition to everything else you're doing, I take seaweed pills.
Posts.Title: Supplements?? What should we do??

Posts.Content: Hello, You may want to consider contacting the American Cancer Society's National Cancer Information Center. Cancer Information Specialists are available 24 hours a day and may be able to assist you with your question. They can be reached at 1-800-227-2345. Take care and be well, Dana CSN Dana
Posts.Title: biopsy to rule out IBC

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, I was diagnosed in May with DCIS. My tumor was 7mm, yet the receptors were positive for estrogen, progesterone and Her 2. I was also told that it was 85% benign calcifications before the needle biopsy results were in.I was told in mammography that they were 99% sure it was benign. I also had the blue dye, I did not pee blue nor did my breast turn blue. I did 33 radiation treatments this summer and I will see my oncologist in two weeks to start aromatase inhibitors and Arimedex. I don't know if I am spelling these right. I am scared. I hate the nature of the tumor. It was aggressive even though it was very small. The did not recommend chemo for that.
Posts.Title: Receptors??

Posts.Content: Hello, The American Cancer Society has a catalog called "tlc" that offers many mastectomy products including a swim prosthesis. The following link will take you directly to the product if you are interested. http://www.tlcdirect.org/products/sku-7840__dept-12.html. Best Wishes! Dana CSN Dana
Posts.Title: postmastectomy comfort

Posts.Content: I will pray that your friend will be receive by our Lord with open arms which I know she will be, and I will also keep you in my prayers. I am still sorry to hear about your friend but yes she is now at peace and no more pain.

Posts.Title: facial pain

Posts.Content: I agree that this is probably from clenching or grinding your teeth. You can make your own "night guard", something to put over your upper teeth to provide cushioning while you sleep. Just get an athletic mouth guard like the boys use for football at the sporting goods store and follow the directions. That is what I use. Mine is just as good as the one the dentist made and cost only $4.00!
Posts.Title: facial pain

Posts.Content: Yes. Mine was removed and had absolutely no problems afterward. Congrats!!!
